gml:Point.gml:name: Tie Point in upper left corner

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Dry Matter Productivity 2014-present (raster 300 m), global, 10-daily - version 1

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Dry matter Productivity (DMP) is an indication of the overall growth rate or dry biomass increase of the vegetation and is directly related to ecosystem Net Primary Productivity (NPP), however its units (kilograms of gross dry matter per hectare per day) are customized for agro-statistical purposes. Compared to the Gross DMP (GDMP), or its equivalent Gross Primary Productivity, the main difference lies in the inclusion of the autotrophic respiration. Like the FAPAR products that are used as input for the GDMP estimation, these GDMP products are provided in Near Real Time, with consolidations in the next periods, or as offline product.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: This product is first designed to fit the requirements of the Global component of Land Service of the Copernicus programme. It can be also useful for all applications related to the environment monitoring.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: DMP products were generated by the Global Land Service of Copernicus, the Earth Observation programme of the European Commission. The research leading to the current version of the product has received funding from various European Commission Research and Technical Development programs. The product is based on PROBA-V 333m data (copyright BELSPO and distribution by VITO NV).

gmd:positionName.gco:CharacterString: Copernicus Global Land Service Help Desk

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: (d) the confidentiality of commercial or industrial information, where such confidentiality is provided for by national or Community law to protect a legitimate economic interest, including the public interest in maintaining statistical confidentiality and tax secrecy.

gml:UnitDefinition.gml:name: kgDM/ha/day

gmd:fees.gco:CharacterString: Free for HTTP download and EUMETCast; cost of medium by DvD or tape

gmd:orderingInstructions.gco:CharacterString: Products can be downloaded online via HTTP or can be received through EUMETCast satellite reception in Europe, Africa and Latin-America.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: 3. Register to receive products via EUMETCast

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Validation results conform CEOS LPV guidelines

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: COMMISSION REGULATION (EU) No 1089/2010 of 23 November 2010 implementing Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards interoperability of spatial data sets and services

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: This data set is conformant with the INSPIRE Implementing Rules for the interoperability of spatial data sets and services

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: INSPIRE Data Specification on orthoimagery - Guidelines

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: As described by Monteith (1972), DMP is estimated from a combination of temperature information and solar radiation information derived from EO satellite data. This version uses the temporally smoothed, gap-filled FAPAR 300m version 1 products as input, together with 0.25 degree temperature data and biome-specific Land Use Efficiency (LUE) values that are calibrated using flux tower measurements.
